result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Brian Trepanier Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Patrick Brian Trepanier in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Marcoux states they have an agreement.
Plea questionaire and waiver of rights given
DEF pleads NC to counts 1 & 2.
Court questions regarding plea questionaire.
Court finds DEF guilty.
ADA Marcoux argues sentence. No restitution requested. 
Court: Sentence withheld, 1 year probation concurrent with any other probation. Absolute Sobriety.

No abusive Contact with  -    KATHLEEN TOSLAND
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "   KATHLEEN TOSLAND  " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
